titles.title: A bill to designate the Federal building located at 333 Mt. Elliott Street in Detroit, Michigan, as the "Rosa Parks Federal Building".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 260.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Dent moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1285.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 11/11/2005--Public Law. Designates the federal building located at 333 Mt. Elliott Street in Detroit, Michigan, as the "Rosa Parks Federal Building." Designates the annex, located at the 200 block of 3rd Street, N.W., District of Columbia, to the E. Barrett Prettyman Federal Building and United States Courthouse as the "William B. Bryant Annex."
